metadata.title: CVE-2019-6133 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In PolicyKit (aka polkit) 0.115, the "start time" protection mechanism canbe bypassed because fork() is not atomic, and therefore authorizationdecisions are improperly cached. This is related to lack of uid checking inpolkitbackend/polkitbackendinteractiveauthority.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-6133` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-polkit-1.0 - 0.105-4ubuntu3.14.04.6
libpolkit-agent-1-0 - 0.105-4ubuntu3.14.04.6
libpolkit-backend-1-0 - 0.105-4ubuntu3.14.04.6
libpolkit-gobject-1-0 - 0.105-4ubuntu3.14.04.6
policykit-1 - 0.105-4ubuntu3.14.04.6
No subscription required

linux-image-3.13.0-166-generic - 3.13.0-166.216

criterions.comment: policykit-1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.105-4ubuntu3.14.04.6').
